PostToolUse.// Auto-formatting Hook: Automatically formats code after editing files based on extension/directory

PostToolUse_FailureHandling.// Failure Pattern Learning Hook: Analyzes command failures to learn patterns and improve future error handling
PostToolUse_FailureHandling.// Environment Detection: Automatically detects environment context (python, typescript, rust, go, nushell)
PostToolUse_FailureHandling.// Data Collection: Records command, exit code, output, and environment for pattern analysis
PostToolUse_FailureHandling.// AI Learning: Uses collected data to provide intelligent failure analysis and solution suggestions
PostToolUse_FailureHandling.// Trigger Condition: Only activates when command exit code is non-zero (failure detected)

hooks.command: bash -c 'exit_code=$(echo "$0" | jq -r ".exit_code // 0" 2>/dev/null || echo "0"); if [[ "$exit_code" != "0" ]]; then command=$(echo "$0" | jq -r ".tool_input.command // \"\"" 2>/dev/null || echo ""); output=$(echo "$0" | jq -r ".tool_result.stderr // .tool_result.stdout // \"\"" 2>/dev/null || echo ""); environment="unknown"; if [[ "$PWD" =~ python-env ]]; then environment="python"; elif [[ "$PWD" =~ typescript-env ]]; then environment="typescript"; elif [[ "$PWD" =~ rust-env ]]; then environment="rust"; elif [[ "$PWD" =~ go-env ]]; then environment="go"; elif [[ "$PWD" =~ nushell-env ]]; then environment="nushell"; fi; echo "ðŸš¨ Command failure detected, analyzing pattern..."; nu nushell-env/scripts/failure-pattern-learning.nu record "$environment" "$command" "$exit_code" "$output" 2>/dev/null || echo "Failure pattern analysis completed"; fi'
